resources.string: Indore is a city in the west-central India. It is the most populous and the largest city in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. It’s known for the 7-story Rajwada Palace and the Lal Baag Palace, which dates back to Indore’s 19th-century Holkar dynasty. The Holkar rulers are honored by a cluster of tombs and cenotaphs at Chhatri Baag. The night market Sarafa Bazar sells street food. East is the Indo-Gothic Gandhi Hall and clock tower.
Rajwada is a historical palace in Indore city. It was built by the Holkars of the Maratha Empire about two centuries ago
Rajwada Circle, Rajwada, Near Holker Cloth Market, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452002, India
Lavish 19th-century palace of the Holkar dynasty, in a mix of baroque, rococo and neoclassical styles.
Nai Duniya, Revenue Colony, Indira nagar, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452007, India
It was established in 1929.The artifacts exhibited in the museum range from the pre-historic to the modern era.
Near GPO Square, Navlakha, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452001, India
Also known as Indore Zoo. This is the largest and one of the oldest zoological parks of the Madhya Pradesh state, spread over an area of 4000 square meters
Agra Bombay Road, Navlakha, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452001, India
Khajrana Ganesh Temple is a pilgrimage center in Indore, dedicated to Lord Ganpanti. Built during reign of Holkar dynasty.
Khajrana Rd, Ganeshpuri Colony, Khajrana, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452016, India
Prominent temple dedicated to the Hindu goddess of food featuring an ornate gate and elephant statues.
